Senior / Associate Fire Protection Engineer | Building Services

Company Name Amida Recruitment Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Cracking Working Culture

  • Development Opportunities

  • Company Share Options


This building services consultancy have recently had a number of good wins and are quietly going about re-establishing their buildings group. They like to fly under the radar and as such you might not even know their name. But hey, sometimes that’s a good thing. What they’re after now is to bolster the Fire team with a Senior or Associate Fire Protection Engineer.


Ideally they want to recruit an Engineer well versed in the market and have extensive experience in fire protection design of building projects across the infrastructure, industrial, educational and commercial sectors. Reporting to the Group Director you’ll be given every opportunity to develop your career.


As such they want you to be very professional and have a natural ability to communicate. They are a small team who have created a cracking working environment so your cultural fit will be just as important.


You’ll obviously need a certain level of experience working in a competing building services consultancy and be looking to join something different, not just looking for a like-for-like company. It’s an opportune time to join a growing business.\xa0


That all sounds well and good coming from me, but I'm sure you'll agree when you sit down with their Directors for a coffee as they have huge plans and need people like you to help achieve it.


For a no strings or CV attached discussion feel free to contact Marc Hammond on +61 (0) 402 413 428 or apply online.



\xa0 \xa0 \xa0\xa0

\xa0

Job description

  • Leading Building Materials Supplier
  • Based Western Suburbs

Our client, with many years' experience supplying quality products to the building industry, requires the services of an experienced Sales Estimator to join their vibrant team based in Melbourne's western suburbs.

In this dynamic, challenging and highly pivotal role, you will be responsible for ensuring that profitable sales are maintained on all projects tendered. Ensuring all tendering timelines are adhered to whilst continually delivering a professional service and outstanding customer care.

Role

To be eligible for and more importantly to be successful in this role you will need to possess the following key attributes
  • Previous estimating experience within a building materials supplier
  • The ability to read plans and sound numeric/financial management skills
  • Thorough attention to detail
  • Excellent time management, presentation and communication skills
  • Sound computer skills especially Excel

Benefits aside from a remuneration experience commensurate with your level of experience, include the opportunity to work and grow within a business that focuses on continuous improvement.

Company Name ARB Corporation Ltd Company Location 42-44 Garden St , Kilsyth, VIC 3137, AU

Posted Date Posted 5 days ago Number of views 178 views

Job description

  • Excellent Career Opportunities
  • Global Iconic Australian Company
  • ASX Top 200 listed Company


A rare and exciting career opportunity exists for a graduate\xa0 to join our talented National Marketing Team. \xa0ARB is Australia’s largest manufacturer and distributor of 4x4 and related accessories, with a large network of stores and stockists around the country and internationally.

\xa0

Working at ARB’s HO in Kilsyth, Victoria, and reporting to the Retail Marketing Manager, the Marketing Assistant will work as part of an energetic and creative marketing team on a range of projects, both large and small, that support our global, national and local marketing objectives. \xa0

\xa0

A day in our busy office will typically see you:-

\xa0

  • Assisting with detailed briefs for graphic designers
  • Responding to local marketing requests
  • Developing content for ARB’s ever-expanding Retail Stores
  • Assisting the Retail Marketing Team on big projects including; national promotions, packaging, catalogue and in-store signage
  • General marketing administration support

\xa0

We’re after a creative, organised and energetic person who loves working in a team with a passion for adventure and the great outdoors.

\xa0

To be successful in this role, you’ll meet or exceed the following criteria.

\xa0

• \xa0 Tertiary qualified in a marketing or related field

• \xa0 Ability to work on multiple projects at once

• \xa0 Excellent writing, editing and proofreading skills

• \xa0 Proficient in the use of the Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign

• \xa0 Strong attention to detail

\xa0

4wd experience and/or a knowledge of ARB’s product range will be highly regarded.

\xa0

To get a feel for our marketing communications, check out our website, read our catalogue online or see what we’re up to on Facebook, YouTube and Instagram.

Senior Network Specialist

Company Name Infosys Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 39 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Senior Network Specialist plays a lead role in the delivery of projects and programmes driving the IT strategic change. A key contributor to the design and implementation of the solution ensuring that IT systems meet the required high standards in the areas of non-functional requirements particularly availability, capacity, performance, security and BCP. This role will be responsible for ensuring all Corporate-related solutions delivered are engineered in accordance with the infrastructure standards/patterns and align to the overall enterprise roadmap of the end customer.


The role is expected to carry out following function/activities as part of this job. This is exhaustive list but not limited to :


  • \xa0Analyze technical needs, requirements, and state of the network’s infrastructure design, integration, and operations.
  • \xa0Lead teams of other network designers and engineers in developing detailed designs and quality-control mechanisms during implementation.
  • Establish governing principles for network design and deployment.
  • Participate in selection of networking technologies and products for implementation
  • Promoting common delivery standards and processes
  • Experience of using automation tools and technologies for build and deployment
  • Performance planning, measurement and impact assessment
  • Creating , Updaing Highlevel and Low Level Design documents
  • Provide help to operations team in complex troubleshooting requirements

\xa0

Experience/Skill requirements

\xa0

Mandatory

\xa0

  • At least 10+ years of experience in LAN/ WAN / Wireless / Security /
  • Expert level Network implementation skills / Understanding Complex Network Environments / Creation of Change Plans
  • Experience in implementing Network changes from LLD / HLDs ,
  • Technical knowledge and experience in management of large enterprise customers network

\xa0

Preferred

\xa0

  • A thorough understanding of architectural design principles.
  • Experience in working with OEMs and developing solutions together
  • Experience working with ISP's and Vendors TAC and support processes.
  • Education Qualification
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering. Number of years of experience may vary based on Bachelors or Master’s Degree. Any additional education will be added advantage

864507345:
[

Customer Advocacy Officer

Company Name Momentum Energy Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 23 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Bring your experience in complaint resolution to Momentum Energy, and help us help our customers.

About you:

You're a great communicator and relationship builder, and you’re passionate about managing relationships with customers and other stakeholders. You’ll bring experience conducting Ombudsman investigations within a regulated industry such as energy or other utilities.


You have a background in delivering superior customer service, and you pride yourself operating in an ethical, personal and respectful manner. You’re also organised, positive and optimistic, and you have sound negotiating techniques, along with analytical and investigative skills.


About the role:
You will investigate and resolve complaints that have been referred to Ombudsman Schemes in a fair, reasonable and timely manner, and you will identify and recommend continuous improvement opportunities.


Complaints will be managed through liaison with customers, the Ombudsman, and other departments within Momentum, and you’ll ensure that responses to the Ombudsman office meet their specific required standards. You’ll advise solutions to customer issues, maintain a complaints database, conduct reporting and analysis, and provide training to Momentum business units in complaint resolution.


What's in it for you?
Firstly, you'll be part of an incredibly fun and rewarding business that values its people and customers, and you’ll work in our fantastic Melbourne CBD offices. We’ll support you in using your expertise to help us help our customers, as you grow your career in our business.\xa0


Momentum also offers benefits like wellness programs (including a wellness allowance), a staff reward program, and special staff energy rates, and various leave options.


If you like the sound of this role, we'd love to hear from you!
To apply, please attach your resume and a cover letter outlining what you’ll bring to the position.


Applications close at 9:00am Wednesday 19th September 2018

865137899:
[

Hybris Architect

Company Name Publicis.Sapient Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 5 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

The future is infinitely wide and begging to be reimagined and SapientRazorfish is looking for people who have the courage to make their dent in what has always been. If you have an optimism that says there is no limit to what we can achieve in a time inviting those with vision to shake things up, then we should talk. Our work is fueled by connected thinking, challenging boundaries, and the power of digital redefining a connected world. Our people thrive because of the belief that it's both our privilege and responsibility to usher our clients and the world into what is next. We're seeking those who question the status quo and want to reimagine the way the world works while realizing a smarter way for business to help - all in service of improving the daily lives of people, the world, your career. Next_reimagined.

Hybris Architect

As a Senior CMS Developer specializing in Hybris you will translate client requirements into technical designs, implement Intranet, public website, design schemas, integrate with ecommerce solutions, and search engines, unlocking the business value of Hybris.

You will drive the translation and construction of clients’ business problems into innovative technology solutions by creating and owning the technical vision of a project to ensure that the vision is achieved with a high level of quality. You will lead teams of SMEs to drive transformative change and high quality commercial outcomes for our clients.

You have a genuine appreciation for creativity and an interest in technology and its impact on humankind. You display intellectual curiosity and openness to learn about new industries, new fields, new disciplines and are excited by change and learning.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Architect digital customer experiences using the Hybris platform.
  • Designing small module or a large component and designing a feature, set of features, or whole feature area in Hybris e-commerce and CPQ platform.
  • Work both independently and with the Hybris DevOps team and to other teams across business. Own and lead design discussions for Hybris e-commerce Projects.
  • Translate client requirements into technical designs, design schemas, integrate with content management solutions, and search engines.
  • Develop scripts and automation tools used to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to Hybris platform.
  • Ensure adoption of best-in-class practices and standards for development, support, quality control and documentation and driving development using Agile/Scrum processes.
  • Drive the preparation and delivery of technical stakeholder interviews, client-facing workshops, and other research efforts to determine key functional and non-functional requirements for a project.

Experience Guidelines
  • University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline.
  • 4 to 10 years’ experience with 2-3 years of content management system and exposure to Hybris.
  • Strong agency, start-up or consulting experience preferred.
  • Comfortable with a variety of processes and approaches like agile development, lean design, and dev ops.
  • Experience implementing all modules of ecommerce (product information, content management, order management, pricing and promotions in B2B, B2C, and B2B2C environments).
  • Experienced in architecting JEE based applications using Spring/OSGi, Hibernate, JMS, REST, SOA, ESB and SSO technologies and extensive implementation knowledge of Software Design Patterns & multi-threaded Asynchronous Programming Models.
  • Comfort with complete application development life cycle including requirements gathering, analysis and design, development, integration, testing, deployment, maintenance and support.
  • Knowledge of Hybris foundational concepts, data modelling with Hybris and integrations as well as the architecture and implementation of Hybris CPQ module which includes both Product configuration (Variant Configuration) and complex solution configuration for ETO (Engineered to order) product lines.
  • Hands on experience on Hybris Datahub and CPQ platform and Integrating with back end systems like SAP ERP, Oracle ERP, Payment Gateways, Social Media Integration. Experience in Hybris platform v5.5 or later, Spring, Hibernate, JUnit, REST, SOAP, JSON, JAXB, XML, XSLT, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS is expected.
  • Good organizational, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Understand how technology solves customer problems from both a technology and business perspective.

Salary 120,000.00 to 150,000.00 / year.

About SapientRazorfish

SapientRazorfish is a new breed of transformation partner purpose-built to help companies reimagine their business through radical customer-centricity. With more than 12,000 employees and 70 offices around the globe, our capabilities span growth and business model strategy, new product and service innovation, customer experience, enterprise digital transformation, IT modernization, omni-channel commerce, precision marketing, change management, digital operations, digital innovation, data strategy and advanced analytics.
